text: EXISTENCE AND IMPROVED REGULARITY FOR A NONLINEAR SYSTEM 15 Observe that, from (??) and (??), we have with (5.6) Although we can not conclude about the convergence of the sequence of matrices we still obtain, again from (??), the estimate (5.7)We conclude the paper with the proof of Theorem ??, which amounts to producing the continuous version of Proposition ??. Proof of Theorem ??. Let be given. Take such that Observe that then From Proposition ?? and estimates (??) and (??), we obtain  for a universal constant The conclusion that, locally, has continuous first order derivatives, with a Log-Lipschitz modulus of continuity, follows from standard arguments in regularity theory.

<math id="S5.Ex34.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\sup_{B_{r}}\left|\theta(x)-(\theta(0)+D\theta(0)\cdot x)\right|%\,\leq\,\sup_{B_{\rho^{n}}}\left|\theta(x)-(\theta(0)+D\theta(0)\cdot x)\right|" display="inline"><mrow><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">sup</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">|</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">≤</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">sup</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><msup><mi>ρ</mi><mi>n</mi></msup></msub></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

<math id="S5.Ex35.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\qquad\,\leq\,\sup_{B_{\rho^{n}}}\left|(\theta-P_{n})+a_{n}-%\theta(0)+b_{n}\cdot x-D\theta(0)\cdot x+\dfrac{x^{t}M_{n}x}{2}\right|" display="inline"><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi/></mpadded><mo rspace="4.2pt">≤</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">sup</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><msup><mi>ρ</mi><mi>n</mi></msup></msub></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msub><mi>b</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>t</mi></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>
